creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
since r448904, i see rendering errors with firefox 1.5.x on linux:
try to force an exception and look at the stack/exception trace.
the box should have a uniform brownish background. however, when you toggle a
traces, the lower half (approximately) turns light beige, and when you toggle
both traces, you might even get some white section in the middle if your
stacktrace is long enough.
no big deal, but might be of interest to the svn module folks.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
The background images have a limited height. The box body background is aligned
to the bottom, therefore the dark brown title background or even the white page
background shine through when the box is sufficiently large. No idea if this can
be fixed using plain CSS.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
I added an extra div for the bottom round corners. I tested it only on Firefox
(Mac OS X). Would you mind giving it another try? Thanks!
I'm closing this one, please reopen if the problem persists.
creator: andreas@apache.org
